Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: Jen017
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from one week at Hotel Louis II. We had an excellent stay. The location is perfect. It's a 5 minute walk to Saint Germain and the Odeon Metro. It's also an easy walk to the Saint Michel Metro, which we took to Versailles. There are countless cafes and restaurants close by to have breakfast if you choose not to eat at the hotel (which we didn't). There's also a Carrefour (grocery store) on St. Germain to pickup wine, snacks, whatever. It's about a 10 minute walk to Notre Dame and not much longer to the Louvre. We couldn't have been happier with the location. Tons of shopping (mainly clothes and accessories) if you'd like. The hotel is small but well maintained. Be forewarned, the rooms are VERY small. We had expected that but were still a little taken aback when we first stepped inside. It took some careful maneuvering and compromises to get around for a week. However, we spent very little time in the hotel room and once we adapted, we were fine with it. This is really a personal preference -- the rooms are quite small by American standards and I can see how it could be bothersome to some people, but if you're not spending much time in the room, it may not be an issue. The bathroom was small but modern with a separate room for the toilet. Rooms were clean and there's a small minibar should you not feel like going out for a drink, water, etc. It was a little noisy -- we had the windows open due to the unseasonably warm weather (in the high 60's / low 70's, in March) and there is a fair amount of nighttime noise, especially Friday and Saturday. I believe it's fine with the windows closed, but we couldn't get the AC to come on (it probably wasn't turned on yet -- who expects to need it in March!) so it got a little loud at times. The front desk staff was what really made this hotel stand out for us. Thomas, the person we worked with the most, was superbly kind and helpful. He made all of our dinner reservations for us, helped us with recommendations, and provided us with all the directions and information we needed. He was wonderful and really made the stay a pleasure. Constantin, who I believe is the director, was the other person we worked with frequently, and he too was continually helpful and friendly. We highly recommend Aux Charpentiers for dinner. It's just around the corner and we ate there twice. It's fairly inexpensive and not fancy but had excellent food and service. Marie was our waitress both times and she was warm and talkative (even with my horrible French...she went out of her way to talk to us in English). All in all, it was a great stay. We would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Left Bank hotel”
Reviews.Author: cam330
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice boutique hotel - very small rooms with a modern bright bath. Very good location. The room was clean but there were a few light bulbs that needed replaced. Somewhat noisy at night, but we were able to close outside shutters which helped. The front desk staff, especially Thomas, was more than helpful in suggesting restaurants and helping us with transportation return to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a good location!”
Reviews.Author: Michaz
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here in mid January 2012 and we got a really good rate online. The location was great, there were shops and restaurants a stone's throw away. Lots of local boutiques as well in the small streets, great for the sales that were on when we were there. Also handy to have close by was Carrefour Express for a cheap do it yourself meal when you don't want to eat out. The room itself is small but we had no problems as we weren't in the room all day, we came back from a long day out and got into bed when we got back to the room. Most important thing was the room was very clean and the bathroom too. The staff were courteous and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay here and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable small hotel on the Rive Gauche”
Reviews.Author: frosty2928
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here in January 2012 for 4 nights. Super location is just off the Boulevard Saint-Germain, just a minute down the street from the Odeon Metro stop and all the shops and restaurants on the Boulevard. Rooms were very small, and the building old (but does have a small lift in addition to a beautiful wood staircase), but the bathrooms were a nice size - closer to what we are used to at home - and up-to-date. The beds are not the greatest, but everything was very clean and quiet. A very friendly and helpful staff was a plus. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a superb location.”
Reviews.Author: SuaimhneasDe
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a really superb location in the heart of Paris. The rooms are warm and spotlessly clean. I have stayed in a number of hotels in the same area and this is definitely the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: D1223chicago
Reviews.Content: great location, nice room, roomy bathroom. Quiet and comfortable. Would definitely come back and recommend

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars Service | Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: ccgalla
Reviews.Content: 5 stars service at a 3 stars hotel. I've spent a good amount of time researching for a mid-range hotel in Paris. Our goal is to find the best location that we have the option not to take metro. We stayed for 6 nights during last week of December. We arrived at 11AM. and was greeted with a warm welcome and was able to check in immediately. Louis upgraded us to a corner room no.32. The room was equipped with basic essentials. Corner room with street views and large windows instantly infused us with joy. The kettle was a plus for us. Although limited space was enough for 2. The clean, minimal, and charming decor was delightful. We would like to thank Louis, Thomas, night shift gentleman (apologize for not knowing your name) and Carla for your SUPERB services!!! You made our stay more enjoyable than many 5 stars hotels. Once again, thanks for accommodating us and made every detail so perfect! Less perfect perspectives... 1. Mattress and pillows could've been more plush. 2. Down pillows and comforter might be a good future addition? 3. Any chance for higher thread counts? 4. Some noise from street bars, but we have a great view and natural light Location 1. Located in Saint Germain and border Quartier Latin. 2. 3 - 5 Minutes walk to Odéon metro 3. Walking distance to Le bon Marche 4. A convenient store is right around the corner 5. Bars and restaurant within a few steps 6. A few blocks away from Seine We couldn't ask for more perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and very well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eyal M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and with enough space to use comparing to other hotels in Paris. The staff personal handled us very well and generally the atmosphere is very warm and nice. The breakfast is great. Sure, you can get other great breakfasts in Paris at mostly the same price but this is very convenient way to start the day. I fully recommend. I even added a link to it on trip advisor on my personal bookmarks page: http://www.linkopa.com/em/traveling Enjoy your stay, Mo

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: RogerP138
Reviews.Content: As is the case with many Paris hotels, the room was tiny - we had to move our bags around the available floor area. The service, however, was excellent, with the two gentlemen on duty always very helpful. The location was superb, between Saint Sulpice and Blvd Saint germain, and close to the lovely Luxembourg Gardens. Unfortunately we had a room opposite a noisy Italian restaurant over the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel close to Luxembourg gardens”
Reviews.Author: LauraEtMichel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Louis II for one night early december 2011. Friendly welcome at reception, charming decor throughout. Small rooms and tiny bathroom but with modern comfort, careful not to drop toiletries in toilet bowl though. Located in a lovely and lively area. We even got a great recommendation for a restaurant close by. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Agreed: "Fantastic Little Find"”
Reviews.Author: Cleeg
Reviews.Content: Great little 3-star hotel in a fantastic location. I give it a 5 for value, service and location. Walk right out the door in you're in the cafe culture. Staff are incredibly pleasant, professional and helpful. Rooms are a little small, making it a little tight with two suitcases, but you're there to see the city. Bathrooms were modern and clean. Sound does travel some between rooms, so you'll hear some muffled coughs, and doors closing. You'll also get some street noise, but nothing you can't sleep through. (or maybe you'll be a part of the street scene). Oh, and free secure WiFi (unique password per user). As simple as it may be, most hotels nickel and dime you with WiFi; not here. Unlimited and free. No device limit. I'll certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little find.”
Reviews.Author: 322Teresa22
Reviews.Content: Romantic little hotel, clean and helpful staff at all times even 3 in the morning. Quiet, AC, great location. Small but well appointed. Teresa Dickinson

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Beautiful Quaint Rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lolo24Sydney
Reviews.Content: This beautiful quaint hotel is located in a great spot in a buzzing area, within close proximity to many eateries and Parisian attractions like Jardin du Luxemburg. Itâ€™s also a minutes walk from the metro, which can take you pretty much anywhere you need to go in Paris. The rooms are on the smaller side, but they are very clean, stylish, and homely, and the beds are extremely comfortable. The service was excellent, staff were extremely helpful. I also had a great view of the surrounding buildings and restaurants. Breakfast wasn't included, it cost 15 Euros per person, so I just picked up something from the bakeries nearby. I was lucky enough to stay at this hotel for 8 nights, and I will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Rooms but Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: KTtravelfan
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The location was wonderful and the staff was so helpful and friendly. We were not at all bothered by neighborhood noise even though the hotel is in the midst of a lot of action. The only downside was that our room was very small but it was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Small Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MontanaXXX
Reviews.Content: I had wonderful 6 night stay at Hotel Louis II this year while on vacation in Paris (itâ€™s my 2nd stay at this hotel). My first stay was in the fall of 2010 (also for 6 nights) and convinced me to return. This small hotel in the 6th Saint-Germain des Pres area (bordering the Latin Quarter) has 22 bright and quiet rooms. I tend to stay on the 4th or 5th floor facing Rue Saint Sulpice which provides a view over the adjoining streets and cafes from the floor to ceiling windows (French doors) that open onto the street. Rooms are small by North American standards but are exceptionally clean and well appointed. The air conditioning works well and there is plenty of hot water plus the water pressure is strong when showering. Breakfast in the downstairs lounge is a feast consisting of croissants, pastries, boiled eggs, yoghurt, fresh fruit, cheese, fresh orange juice, coffee or tea and is well worth the added cost. The hotel is conveniently located with Metro Line 4 only a block away (which goes to the St. Ouen Antique Market), the Seine is a 5 minute walk (with the Louvre directly across) and itâ€™s a 10 minute walk to Notre Dame. The immediate area surrounding the hotel has wonderful cafes, restaurants and shops to explore (Laduree is also a 10 minute walk away). The Hotel staff are friendly and very helpful with directions, taxis, reservations and recommendations. I plan to stay at the Louis II again on my next visit to Paris as it has everything I want. Special thanks to Thomas, Louis, Carla and Martin for making my stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly and Helpful, plus Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tpmetz
Reviews.Content: Everyone was wonderfully helpful and truly concerned about us enjoying our stay, Especially Louis, Serge and Martin; they became friends to us. The typical European breakfast buffet was very good and plentiful, with great service. The neighborhood is charming with wonderful shops and restaurants on the surrounding streets. The location is in easy walking distance to many major sights of the city, as well as very close to the Metro and several bus stops that will take you anywhere you wish to go. We explored a lot of the city in the four days we were there and always felt like we were coming home as we neared this charming hotel in the evening. The room was typically small as most in Europe, but was very clean and sound proof with excellent air conditioning, big bright windows and a great view of the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel during a 16 day trip to Europe”
Reviews.Author: BG082802
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled throughout Europe and had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Louis II for three night. The location is perfect...great neighborhood, close to the metro and bus stops for easy access to CDG airport and the train station. There are a ton of great restaurants in the neighborhood and the hotel is within walking distance of many great attractions and parks. The staff was so helpful and friendly...the best on our trip. When we return to Paris we will book the Louis II again. Until then we will look back on our first stay with amazing memories and happy thoughts. The only negative is that the room was small, but the air conditioning worked very well and the breakfast was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ncodina
Reviews.Content: I have been travelling to Paris for 3 years now, twice a year and I always stay at Hotel Louis II. It is conveniently located, the staff is extremely nice and polite and the area is superb. The rooms and bathrooms are clean and tastely decorated. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation to anyone. This summer I stayed with my family (2 adults+2 children). Their family room is cute and all the rooms I have stayed at overlook the street. They are not too big but hei, who spends time in a hotel room while in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good service, good price, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: sarah81Cairo
Reviews.Content: We were on a long haul vacation for the month of august and spent four days in Paris passing through. We picked the hotel because it was near to a where a friend was living. Regardless of why we picked the location, we found that this was an excellent place to stay. Saint Germain is one of the most happening places to be in Paris and a close enough to walk to everything. There is a famous foodie restaurant next door and some great cocktail bars and bistros across the street. The hotel was comfortable, clean and had a rustic decor that was cute and felt like Paris. The staff was very nice and spoke english and the price compared to what I have paid before in Paris was very reasonable. HOWEVER, it is important to note, that we were traveling for a month and had large suitcases. Two people and these suitcases barely fit into the room. Keeping in mind that this is not unusual in Paris, it would have been much more comfortable if we had taken into account either the size of our suitcase or the size of our room.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel in a perfect location for an authentic experience”
Reviews.Author: humanb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small, the rooms and bathrooms are tiny, and you can barely open the front door to your room without failing down the stairs, because there's so little hallway space. But this is Europe people. If you want big, bland and wasteful go to Walmart. This hotel is charming. The common areas and bedrooms are tastefully appointed, the bed is comfortable, there are great views on to Paris' charming streets, and the front desk staff are friendly. I never had the breakfast there, which is not complimentary, and it looked like few people did. But there is so much at your doorstep by way of food. The location of this hotel could not be better, and the fact that it offers few amenities means that you are encouraged to explore the Latin Quarter for your food and entertainment. However, there is a flat screen TV in the room and a computer by the front desk with free internet and printing services. If you're going to Paris, you should stay in the Latin Quarter and you should stay in this hotel. It's that simple!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great hotel - go there”
Reviews.Author: DaneAarhus_Denmark
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights and loved the hotel and especially the location. It's right at the very centre of many restaurants and cafÃ©es and just a 5 min walk from Jardin Du Luxembourg. We didn't eat breakfast since the area is packed with cafÃ©es - and the breakfast at the hotel is quite expensive (and for the look of it not very special). Only downside (and that's a big one). Upon departure I was paying by creditcard and the hotel automatically converted the euro amount into my own currency at a ridiculous rate. Normally you pay the amount in the local currency, so I didn't notice that the hotel had converted it beforehand. That's not acceptable in my opinion - I've calculated the to about 15 euros!!! Very dissapointing service at a otherwise perfect hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Cool. Clean. Perfectly located. 18 year old son shared our room.”
Reviews.Author: djaffray2
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights and loved it all. We had room 62 on the top floor, and once we got over the fear of knocking ourselves out on the beams in the slanted ceiling, it was perfect. Clean, clean, clean. The A/C worked perfectly (though it was cool while we were there). The staff were very friendly and helpful. We didn't have breakfast there, but the fellow at the front desk made several successful dining recommendations. Very easy to get around via Metro. Free Internet was enjoyed by all. 265 Euros per night, but I don't think that was unreasonable for a great place in the city. I will stay there again next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy place conveniently located to visit museums”
Reviews.Author: Migrating-islander
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights at this hotel in my first visit to Paris. The hotel is only a short distance from the metro-station, Odeon. It was very conveniently located to visit Louvre, dâ€™Orsay, lâ€™Orangerie and Cathedrale Notre-Dame. Restaurants, cafes, shops and marche (or market) are located within walking distance and I enjoyed exploring the neighbors by walk. The hotel has a mixed taste of old and new. While the hotel maintains the old charm with the classic decoration inside, the room was renovated in a modern fashion. Because of this, the room was very small even for a single person. There was almost no space to put baggages on the floor. But the amenities were clean and current. The quite settled atmosphere was very comfortable to stay. All the staffs were very kind and helpful in all the way to give information needed for visitors. You may use free internet service in the computer located beside the reception. Most of the staffs use English and I did not have any inconvenience in the stay. The only negative side of this hotel was the sound from the street in the night time. On Saturday night loud voices from nearby cafes continued far into the early morning. It was only on Saturday. In other nights I enjoyed good sleep. Among many hotels in Paris, the room rate of this hotel was very modest and the service was by far my expectation. I greatly enjoyed my first stay in Paris in this cozy place and efficiently explored many attractions nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and the staff was pleasant"”
Reviews.Author: LeslieGH
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this charming hotel. The location was convenient and the room was comfortable. The staff was helpful and I hope to go back again on my next trip. It had all the amenities I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Planning our next trip already”
Reviews.Author: jagsilver
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about the staff and accommodations. The friendly staff went out of their way to obtain restaurant reservations, as well as providing helpful information concerning directions, etc. The location is in the heart of the St. Germain area which provides great food, shopping and sightseeing. The rooms and bathrooms were very comfortable by anyone's standards. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Magnigfique!”
Reviews.Author: CityWendy
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at Louis II for four nights in May, 2011, and had a wonderful time. The location cannot be beat â€” the hotel is nestled in the trendy St. Germain neighborhood, just blocks from the famed Seine, and feet away from some wonderful restaurants, bars, boutiques, cafes, and the incredible Luxembourg Gardens. The staff here is very helpful and friendly and speak excellent english. My husband and I wanted to make reservations at this fancy restaurant we'd heard about and after calling the place several times without getting through, one of the concierge members actually walked to the restaurant (a good 15 minute walk, at least) and made the reservations for us in person! Our room was very small, but well-appointed, clean and comfortable. The a/c worked well, and we had everything we needed. Besides, who wants to spend all day indoors when you're in beautiful Paris?? The breakfast was good, though I wouldn't say it was a "deal." The price was fine and should be enjoyed at least once during your stay, but I'd also suggest hitting up one of the local bakeries, picking up a pain au croissant and eating your breakfast in the nearby Luxembourg Gardens. I also recommend the delicious Lâ€™Avant Comptoir across the street for a meal or snack any time of the day (the jambom croquettes are not to be missed!). We loved Paris and we loved Louis II. We hope to visit both again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and super service”
Reviews.Author: Fredrik_P
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we immediately got a very good service from a very nice staff. They really supported us by getting a cod in place, warming baby food in the microwave every day, giving directions and recommendations upon request. The rooms are very clean and have everything that you need and there is an elevator for our baby's trolley. The rooms are small but it suited us fine since we didn't spend much time there. There are many nice restaurants in the area, both for breakfast and dinner. We had breakfast at "Rue de buci" most of the mornings which is close to the Supermarket, Carrefour (Rue de Seine) where we bought water and baby food. It is easy to travel from Charles de Gaulle with RER B to Notre Dame-Saint Michel, or Luxembourg, and walk from there. Since Louis II is located between the Louvre, Notre Dame and Tour Eiffel it is convenient to walk or use the buses. We had a nice stay in Paris and saw most of the "musts" and will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LFM0709
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel last week. The staff was very accommodating and helpful, especially Louis who went above and beyond to rearrange furniture in our room to ensure we were happy. One staffer seemed "short" with us, which wasn't very welcoming. This is a great location when trying to move around Paris easily as Odeon Metro station is right next door and you can walk to the Louvre, Notre Dame, and the Luxembourg Gardens. Also close to a great section of town for food and bars. A little difficult to sleep as a late night bar next door had folks spilling into the streets until all hours of the night and they were very loud. Bring your earplugs. Also note, that if you buy a Carnet (10 metro, RER, bus tickets)...and plan on using them to get to CDG Airport via metro...those passes wont work and you will get stuck in the train station without access to LEAVE the station to enter the airport. There is no person or machine to buy the proper ticket by the time you arrive at this station. Also, do not eat breakfast at the hotel...way too expensive and you have to make it yourself with no help. Walk a block to one of the 50 cafes in the area or hit Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Brkln71
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Louis II in Paris for 5 nights for business. The rooms are small, but this is unavoidable in Paris. However, the hotel and rooms are well decorated and very quaint. The staff speaks good English and were always very helpful. The breakfast downstairs is very good. The hotel is located close to the Odeon subway stop and is convenient to move about Paris whether for leisure or for work. There are many good restaurants within walking distance. Overall I had a very satisfactory stay.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Perfect”
Reviews.Author: dwaNtheATL
Reviews.Content: Location is top notch; great restaurants and cafes are right there! Staff is good, especially Louis who was just great! Odeon Metro station is also just around the corner. Very clean (which I am picky about) and while the shower was small, the water pressure is great and there was never a shortage of hot water. The rooms are small but are in line with other Paris hotel rooms and we had enough room for all our things. Free wi-fi, also. I would only say that better sound proofing would be appreciated, as it is in a lively neighborhood and street noise is a minimal problem (ear plugs and Ambien help). The street noise does die down, but if you are a light sleeper, use ear plugs. The only other improvement is that it might be time for new mattresses...ours did sag a bit. (Which were the reasons for the 3 sleep quality rating). No hotel is perfect. We chose the hotel because the location was superb and the reviews here were good and we were not disappointed. We would stay there again and enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: Lireland
Reviews.Content: Great Location but very expensive. Hotel Staff were very helpful and friendly. The rooms were very small and very expensive but the location was fantastic. Very central

Reviews.Title: “graet hotel”
Reviews.Author: oryann72
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, every thing was just perfect. Rooms are small but planed very good and it was very comfortable. Very nicely decorated and very clean. The stuff is the best that can be: always very polite and nice and really helpful. Location is just wonderful. We certainly recommend this hotel and we will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel with great staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: EuropeTraveler2000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Louis II for 5 nights at the end of October 2010. Our room was on Floor 2 (3rd floor for Americans) and it overlooked the Marco Polo restaurant across the street. You will read that the hotel rooms are small and this is true if you compare them to typical rooms in the US. However, we have learned to travel light and the room was large enough to accommodate us and our luggage without issue. The bathroom is also small, but everything is very clean and the hotel staff is wonderful. We consulted with the front desk staff each day of our stay and each spoke excellent English and were very friendly and helpful - recommending both sights and restaurants in the area. It is a two minute walk to the Odeon Metro station and there is a nice little market about two blocks away. Lots of restaurants in the area (I recommend Marco Polo and Le Comptoir which are within one block from the hotel. (Go make a reservation at Le Comptoir a couple nights in advance. We did not, and waited for 50 minutes to be seated. - Remember, the French frequently sit and talk for hours after their meals!) The free wireless internet access and flat screen TV worked perfectly and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, great staff”
Reviews.Author: LinaMac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in early October but honestly probably couldn't have stayed more because the room was so incredibly small and we had tons of luggage and gifts because we were at the end of our trip. It was the smallest room of the entire 21 days we spent in Europe. The staff definitely made up for it, though. We were leaving on the day of the big strike so transportation to the airport was an issue and the front desk staff was very helpful and accommodating. The location of the hotel is ideal - right near St. Sulpice Church, the Odeon, the Luxembourg Gardens, wonderful restaurants (one that Anthony Bourdain filmed a segment on - Le Comptoir du Relais...make reservations!) and great shopping. So, if you're somewhat light on luggage, a great place to stay!!! We'd go back, though.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely boutique hotel on the left bank”
Reviews.Author: OCMitford
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly situated on the left bank: close to fantastic cafes, patisseries, boulangeries, and the metro. The staff are extraordinarily helpful and friendly, and the public areas are lovely. Although the rooms are definitely small--and among the smallest I have ever been in--they were clean and offered picturesque views of the cafes below. My family and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: MPJJE
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely and quaint little hotel right in the heart of the bustling St-Germain de Pres area. While our room was very tiny (by North American standards, but normal by Paris standards), it was quite comfortable, and had all the amenities required for a 5 night stay. We had the luxury of a bathtub, which was great after a long day of walking and touring the sites. This area can be quite noisy most of the time, but our room featured 'air', so we slept very well with our windows closed. The service at this hotel is impeccable, the staff were friendly, cheerful and very helpful. We did'nt try the 'grand dejeuner' available in the lobby, but it looked great. There are dozens of nice little bistros and tiny restaurants in the area - and the area really hops around 8:30 pm. Just ask Louis!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing. Recommend everyone to stay.”
Reviews.Author: preaw
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my mum for 5 nights 31July to 5 August. Was an amazing experience. really worth the money. Location: The hotel is in the city centre. Near many attractions (you can actually walk there) : Lourve, Jardin du Luxembourg, Boulevard St Germain. There are many cafes for you to sit and relax. There are also many great local casual restaurants nearby you can walk there and grab a good dinner. There is a supermarket and a phamarcy nearby. It is also very close to Odeon metro (and this staion is only a few stations away from many attractions in Paris). The closest bus stop can get you to Musee d'Orsay in 15 minutes. Room: A little small but i'm sure other hotel in the heart of Paris would be like this. Comfortable bed and clean bathroom. Staff: this is the best thing about this hotel. Their staffs are very nice! very friendly and helpful! always take time to help us and give good suggestions. (especially Mr.Louis!) it was my first time in Paris and i wasn't sure of so many things. Mr.Louis helped us a lot. he advised us on the best way to go to places we want. where the good local restaurants are. before paris, we went to 4 countries but i have to say that this hotel really has the best staff + best service. we are really impressed and happy! Free wifi: free wifi throughout the stay! if the price is still this good, i recommend everyone to stay here! :)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Louis Went Above and Beyond!”
Reviews.Author: Designerlady
Reviews.Content: After attending a wedding in Brittany, mother-of-bride and I spent a few additional days in Paris. We arrived late, and were simply handed our keys and a nice welcome, rather than usual check-in song-and-dance with credit card, computer, etc., a nice surprise. Hotel is at corner of two restaurant streets with plenty of cafe noise, but windows were insulated so we slept great and enjoyed watching the "scene" out our window. The really amazing experience I had was the help I received from Louis, a staff member who worked mostly days. I left my clothing suitcase in Brittany at our gite! Was really bummed, had no idea how to retrieve it from a somewhat remote village. I explained my predicament to Louis, who calmly told me he had several options which he would explore to get the suitcase or its contents back. He did just this, and without any fuss he saved the day! It was not easy for him, however, as it entailed several calls and a few tricks up his sleeve! This is the kind of service that will have me back to this very chic little hotel. Room was no. 37, I would recommend checking to see if your room has space to open WC doors at foot of bed(s)--Ours did not, but I saw that others had a few more feet. We still loved our little room, immaculate and cozy and cute.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: FoodNomad53
Reviews.Content: Great location in midst of many restaurants, shops, and vibrant nightlife on the weekend we stayed. Our room was small as expected, but we had all the space we needed including two large suitcases. We had very attentive service from hotel staff, especially Thomas, who provided us recommendations / reservations for dinner on successive nights (both dinners were very good!). The rooms air conditioning worked well, however, we chose to leave our window open at night (we prefer fresh outside air). Despite this being a vibrant area, the noise level at night was modest enough to allow for a good night sleep. Two blocks down the street is St. Sulpice Catholic Church where we were fortunate to visit at the same time an organ / choir concert was underway, awesome performances. Free WiFi worked perfectly with our Apple iPhones in our room. We did not select the hotel breakfast option, therefore I cannot attest to the breakfast offering.

Reviews.Title: “goog hotel”
Reviews.Author: isaekoi
Reviews.Content: very comfortable, kind people and easy to access Odeon station!

Reviews.Title: “A 5 star experience in a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamesangela
Reviews.Content: Simply wonderful. Homely, inviting, superb attention to detail and excellent customer sevice. We stayed for two nights and had a lovely time. The room we had (44) was rather on the small side for my wife, 3 year old son and I but the hotel itself was simply perfect. Don't allow the sign outside to put you off, it doesn't fit with the design or decor and with such a fantastic logo on the inside I don't understand why they want to have some tacky glowing neon ' all beer $5' style sign, but that is really just a minor detail. The location is perfect and the room was very cosy, be prepared for a sumptious experience but the beds are VERY soft, which is great initially but our backs were killing us! The reception area, wow..you could spend hours in there just reading books and drinking coffee, its just incredible to sit there and soak it all in. Top hotel, top location, and decent prices too, although as a city as beautiful as it is, Paris is wickedly expensive, but then we live in Berlin and its cheap as chips here!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: SNewmanMonaVale_NSW
Reviews.Content: Louis II Manager, Guillaume Jouvin, and his staff went out of their way to help with absolutely everything - they could not have been more helpful and charming. The wonderful locality together with the warm personal attention is all one could wish for a Paris hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We love it!!”
Reviews.Author: travelbugsy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in this hotel a number of times and it is our absolute favorite in Paris! It is spotlessly clean, fabulously located and has lots of character. The rooms are small but all rooms in Paris are compact unless you stay in the Hilton or somewhere like that. You have everything you need in the rooms and we always manage to get a good night's sleep here too as it's nice and quiet. The staff are always polite and very helpful. You can get cheaper n the area but it would be difficult to find somewhere as charming, nice and pleasant within the price bracket. I can't recommend it highly enough!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: MWjerusalem
Reviews.Content: last month i spent a few days in this hotel .It is very central location.The rooms are small but with modern comfort in an ancient athmosphere. The hotel is clean and the staff is very nice and helpfull .

Reviews.Title: “A perfect little hotel”
Reviews.Author: AthensHarry
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Louis II for a week and we liked it very much. The rooms are small but adequate. There isn't a big selection for breakfast but everything is fresh and enough to start your day. The hotel is very clean and the staff is perfect. Everyone was very helpful and allways with a smile on their faces. Decoration was beautiful with antique furniture. The air condition in room continued working after taking off the card so the room was cool even after we came back from a long hot August day. Free WiFi is a plus. Everything is close and in walking distance and there is a great variety of places to eat around the hotel. Try eating at "petit coure" which is near the hotel but reserve a table prior to going there. It's a great restaurant with typical french cuisine and great service. Ask the receptionist to make the reservation for you. The metro station is very close. We will definately stay in Louis II again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location- clean, small”
Reviews.Author: DCInsider
Reviews.Content: I didn't go to Paris to stay in my hotel room. Nor be in a spa, nor soak in a tub, nor order breakfast in bed. So if you are looking for a hotel that is really a place to sleep and shower that is clean, in a safe and fun part of town- then this is great. If you want a luxury hotel, this is not for you. There are really no amenities other than great location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, elegant and friendly, can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: TicandToc
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel last minute, we booked a Superior Double Room with Shower. On arrival the man on reception was incredibly friendly and welcoming. He was very supportive and encouraging of my feeble attempt to speak French too taking care to respond very slowly in French first and then clarified in English as well. We were given an upgrade to a Superior Double with Bath and shower, I think it was room 48. The room had very effective air con which is a HUGE plus in a Paris summer. The other thing we liked was that although fairly small (as most Paris hotel rooms are unless you pay top dollar) it was styled in a contemporary colours. Very simple white linens and towels, white walls and simple but elegant furniture that maximised the space. We've stayed in a lot of Parisien hotels and find that the small rooms are made even more claustraphobic with busy patterns on the bedding and walls and some even cover the wardrobes in the same garrish paper! Not here, just simple understated style. The location is great and literally just round the corner from the Odeon metro stop and it's surrounded by tons of restaurants and bars but manages to stay peaceful after around 11-ish at night so we slept soundly. We are currently saving up to go back and this hotel will be top of our list - first choice, first class, can't say much more - just loved the place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful experience!”
Reviews.Author: EricGettingAway
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a lucky find for me. After leaving the Odeon Saint-Germain across the street (horrible room and service, despite the Fodor's stars!!), I wandered over to the Louis II. What a wonderful surprise! The room (on the fifth floor) was beautifully sunny, with nice views in two directions. The air conditioning (this is a hot July in Paris!) REALLY worked--for those of you Americans who have traveled in France you know how rare this is! And the service from the front desk staff was so woderfully pleasant, efficient and helpful. The hotel's location is amazing--right in the heart of the Saint Germain des Pres area, so easy to walk everywhere, or catch a metro anywhere else. I would return to this hotel any time--I'm already looking forard to it.

Reviews.Title: “Very very noisy and small rooms”
Reviews.Author: wanted_traveller
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel based on the good reviews on trip advisor, however there were some bad reviews as well (which I wish I had relied on). I got the room for 130Euros/night which is much cheaper than the standard price on the website and I still do not think it is good value! The room was very small and there was not even one feature that I could mention as a good point! The only good thing about the hotel, is its location, if you want to be the heart of st Germain. The worst thing is the noise, not from the outside, but from the hotel! You can hear the next door neighbour zipping up his suitcase!!! I am a heavy sleeper and hardly ever complain about the noise but when since early in the morning you can hear people showering and cleaners hoovering and moving about (I always thought the cleaner was hoovering just outside my door!!!), it is impossible to sleep or relax!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous...”
Reviews.Author: GenSegal
Reviews.Content: We made a double-room order for off-season price (50%) through the internet, and got confirmation almost instantly. All our questions, sent by email, were answered exactly and very quickly. As we arrived, we were delighted to discover the charm of the hotel. The room was very small, but it included full-size bath, everything was very clean and new. We lived on the second floor and our room had two big windows to the street (St. Sulpice), but there was no noise in the room. The staff was very helpful, understanding and polite. The location of the hotel is it's another big advantage. 800 m from Notre Dame! We started our walks every day from this famous chapel! We even didn't use our week passes for the metro+bus, because we did not need it. We recommend this hotel to everyone who would like to live in unique Paris atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely sublime...we will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: DreamingSydney
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in the Hotel Louis 11 for 5 nights in September 2008. We had the best experience. The staff were so friendly and helpful...nothing seemed to be too much bother. Our two teenage boys felt right at home and still talk about their morning hot chocolate. The location was fantastic with the Luxembourg Gardens at the end of the street and the Seine a mere 10 minute walk not to mention all the wonderful restaurants and shopping around the Boulevard St Germain. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: LeonieSDdublin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from the 23rd-26th of October.It is the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in Paris and I have been to Paris a lot! Not only was it beautifully decorated but it was spotlessly clean. The attention to detail is quiet impressive, even the tiger lilies in the reception area looked like they had been taken from the Monet gardens at Givenchy! Most importantly the staff were absolutely superb. They gave me helpful advice about metro lines I had not used before . Also in the evening after a long day sightseeing a welcome cup of Mariage Frere tea was offered in the beautiful reception area. For me Hotel louis ii is a perfect base because it is a extremely comfortable hotel with an impressive attention to detail which I like.Its central location close to the jardin de luxembourg & RER B TO CDG airport are also a bonus . I would highly recommend this hotel. Leonie

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel! A fantastic experience all round”
Reviews.Author: LucyLuBrighton
Reviews.Content: Hotel Louis II is an absolutely wonderful hotel. I have no complaints whatsoever. The rooms are of course on the small side, but this is Paris! If you want palatial space, then you have to pay for it or go elsewhere. The rooms are air conditioned, which is a must in the summer heat in Paris. They are extremely clean, including the bathrooms - ours was spotless at all times. Mimi bar is well stocked, cable Tv was handy. The whole experience was so lovely and I will definitely be going back. The staff were all so friendly and so helpful. The bar area is gorgeous, continuing the boutique theme in all the rooms which are beautifully decorated. We didn't try the breakfast, as at â‚¬14 per person, seemed silly when the local bars and cafes are so great. The area around the hotel is really lovely, and surprisingly calm considering how central it is. A lot of lovely restaurants to choose from too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Louis II - I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: paul_copley
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel. Fantastic location, great (US-standard), friendly service, very clean. Rooms small but air-conditioned and very well decorated. For the price, it's unbeatable - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “a hotel to fall in love with”
Reviews.Author: milupa23
Reviews.Content: a trip to paris, on the new eurostar from st pancras, london - this hotel made it perfect. lovely, unique, characterful, elegant, a bit quirky - everything i want from a hotel. the location is just right as well. everybody working there was helpful: my single room came with a shower, which i hadn't realized when booking - they sweetly upgraded me (low season) to a double, with a lovely bathroom, and even a separate wc. the off-white/touches of gold colour scheme with visible beams make the room feel inviting. the breakfast room is like a gay friend's flamboyant living room, filled with antique/briq-a-brac finds. the breakfast itself is simple (french) but finest quality. i had food poisoning (not from food in the hotel!!!) and was brought mariages freres teas and sympathy to the room. altogether wonderful and recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jml5q
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights from March 20-23. We booked a standard double room directly through the website with a buy 2 nights get one free, so we paid 380 euros for 3 nights. The location was great â€“ about an 5 minutes walk to the Seine and Notre Dame. About 3 minutes to the Latin Quarter restaurants and 5 minutes to St. Germaine restaurants. Also about 5 minutes to the closet metro stop. The room was small, but large enough for both of us to be in comfortably with luggage. The bed was comfy and the shower pressure good. The lobby had a computer with free internet access and the bar downstairs sold very reasonably priced drinks. Although we didnâ€™t ask much of the staff, they were very friendly. I would certainly stay here again.
